title: (Optional) Install containerized UD/UCMDB (EKS)
content:
The Native SACM and SAM solutions require a UD/UCMDB system to work with Service Management. Once you have completed the Service Management installation, you can continue to install UD/UCMDB on the same OMT cluster as the next deployment (Service Management is the first deployment). Additionally, to enable Service Management to work with the containerized UD/UCMDB, you must configure a load balancer between Service Management and UD/UCMDB. 

Note: This task is optional. If you plan to use classic UD/UCMDB, skip this task and follow the classic UD/UCMDB documentation instead.

Step1: Install the containerized UD/UCMDB

Perform the following steps to install the containerized UD/UCMDB:

Topic Description
Plan Review the required resources and create a deployment plan for the installation of UD/UCMDB with EKS:
  1. Review support matrix
  2. Review sizing considerations
Prepare and deploy Prepare the required resources for the installation of UD/UCMDB with EKS:
  1. Launch EKS cluster worker nodes for UD/UCMDB
  2. Download UD/UCMDB chart package
  3. Download and upload images for UD/UCMDB
  4. Configure EFS for UD/UCMDB
  5. Prepare persistent volumes for UD/UCMDB
  6. Launch RDS for UD/UCMDB
  7. Create UD/UCMDB integration admin user in suite IdM
  8. Create my-values.yaml
  9. Create a new deployment for UD/UCMDB
  10. Generate vault secrets
  11. Install UD/UCMDB on AWS
  12. Verify the UD/UCMDB installation
  13. Configure load balancers for UD/UCMDB
Uninstall Uninstall UD/UCMDB on AWS with EKS
Note 
  • You must install UD/UCMDB on the same OMT on which Service Management is installed.
  • For this release, you must use separate RDS and EFS instances for Service Management and the containerized UD/UCMDB.

Step 2: Configure an Application Load Balancer for integration

To enable Service Management and the containerized UD/UCMDB to work together on AWS, you need to configure an internal Application Load Balancer (ALB) between the Network Load Balancer (NLB) of Service Management and the NLB of UD/UCMDB. For details, see Create Application Load Balancer for integration.

Step 3: Associate UD/UCMDB SuperAdmin role

Before you can access UD/UCMDB with the suite-admin account, you need to Associate UD/UCMDB SuperAdmin role (EKS)
